message.content:
Q1: 2: I found myself getting upset by quite trivial things occasionally, but it didn't dominate my mood throughout the week.
Q2: 2: I was aware of dryness of my mouth at times, especially when I was focused on analyzing data for extended periods.
Q3: 2: I couldn't seem to experience any positive feeling at all on a few occasions, mostly when dealing with particularly challenging research findings.
Q4: 1: I did not experience breathing difficulty during the past week.
Q5: 2: I felt like I couldn't seem to get going a couple of times, but overall, I managed to stay focused on my research tasks.
Q6: 2: I tended to over-react to situations occasionally, especially when faced with unexpected issues in my data analysis.
Q7: 1: I did not have a feeling of shakiness during the past week.
Q8: 3: I found it difficult to relax due to the demands of my research and the pressure to publish. It was hard to switch off from work thoughts.
Q9: 2: I found myself in situations that made me anxious at times, especially when presenting my research at conferences, but it was manageable.
Q10: 2: I felt that I had nothing to look forward to briefly when facing a particularly challenging research problem, but it passed.
Q11: 2: I found myself getting upset rather easily a few times, mainly when facing setbacks in my research progress.
Q12: 2: I felt that I was using a lot of nervous energy while preparing for a presentation, but it was temporary.
Q13: 2: I felt sad and depressed briefly after receiving critical feedback on a research proposal, but I was able to bounce back.
Q14: 2: I found myself getting impatient when delayed in some situations, like waiting for experiment results, but it did not greatly impact me.
Q15: 1: I did not have a feeling of faintness during the past week.
Q16: 2: I felt that I had lost interest in just about everything for a brief period, but it was likely due to burnout from work.
Q17: 2: I felt I wasn't worth much as a person momentarily, particularly after a challenging peer review feedback, but I know it's part of the process.
Q18: 2: I felt that I was rather touchy sometimes, especially when under pressure to meet research deadlines.
Q19: 1: I did not perspire noticeably during the past week.
Q20: 1: I did not feel scared without any good reason.
Q21: 2: I felt that life wasn't worthwhile briefly, mostly when overwhelmed with research responsibilities, but it was temporary.
Q22: 3: I found it hard to wind down after long days in the lab and analyzing data. The stress of work often lingered even during relaxation time.
Q23: 1: I did not experience difficulty in swallowing during the past week.
Q24: 2: I couldn't seem to get any enjoyment out of the things I did briefly when facing writer's block, but I pushed through it.
Q25: 1: I was not aware of the action of my heart in the absence of physical exertion.
Q26: 2: I felt down-hearted and blue after hearing about funding cuts for research projects, but I remained motivated to seek alternative sources.
Q27: 2: I found that I was very irritable at times, especially when interrupted during intense data analysis, but I managed it.
Q28: 1: I did not feel I was close to panic during the past week.
Q29: 2: I found it hard to calm down after something upset me, particularly after a heated discussion in a research group meeting, but I regrouped.
Q30: 1: I was not unable to become enthusiastic about anything during the past week.
Q31: 2: I found it difficult to tolerate interruptions to what I was doing during intense data analysis, but I adapted to minimize distractions.
Q32: 2: I was in a state of nervous tension occasionally, especially before submitting a grant proposal, but it didn't persist.
Q33: 2: I felt I was pretty worthless briefly when facing rejection of a research paper, but I refocused on improving it.
Q34: 2: I was intolerant of anything that kept me from getting on with what I was doing for a brief moment, particularly when requests for additional administrative tasks piled up.
Q35: 1: I did not feel terrified during the past week.
Q36: 2: I could see nothing in the future to be hopeful about temporarily after a grant rejection, but I remained determined to secure funding.
Q37: 2: I felt that life was meaningless briefly when facing setbacks in a research project, but I knew it was a passing feeling.
Q38: 3: I found myself getting agitated due to the workload pressure and high expectations in academia. It was challenging to find moments of calm.
Q39: 1: I was not worried about situations in which I might panic and make a fool of myself.
Q40: 1: I did not experience trembling in the hands during the past week.
Q41: 2: I found it difficult to work up the initiative to do things at times, particularly when facing complex data analysis tasks, but I pushed through it.
